revision.comment: Consensus at [[Template talk:Aviation lists#RfC: Should this navbox be removed from non-mentioned articles?]] using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text: {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin | name=Loose Special | image= | caption= }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type | type=[[Racing aircraft]] | national origin=[[United States|America]] | manufacturer= | designer=Chet Loose{{cite web|title=Loose Special|url=http://siris-thesauri.si.edu/ipac20/ipac.jsp?session=13215780L388C.3493&profile=planes&uri=link=3100020~!43271~!3100001~!3100002&aspect=subtab13&menu=search&ri=1&source=~!sithesauri&term=Loose+%28Chet%29+Siem+%28Warren%29+Special+NX64573&index=DOAAMB#focus|accessdate=17 November 2011}} | first flight= | introduced=1933 | retired= | status= | primary user= | more users= | produced= | number built=1 | program cost= | unit cost= | developed from= | variants with their own articles= }} |} The '''Loose Special''', also called the '''Townsend A-1 Special''', the '''Loose-Siem Special''' and the '''Townsend Special''' is a small [[Air racing|air racer]] developed for the [[Thompson Trophy]] races.{{cite web|title=Clarance Ace Bragunier|url=http://www.dmairfield.org/people/bragunier_ac/index.html|accessdate=17 November 2011}} ==Design== The Loose Special is a small single seat racer with [[conventional landing gear]] and a [[flying wires|cable-braced]] [[mid-wing]].{{cite journal|magazine=Skyways|date=October 2001}} The engine was replaced with a {{convert|85|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} Continental to compete in the [[Formula One Air Racing|Formula One air races]].{{cite journal|magazine=Flying Magazine|date=December 1947}} ==Operational history== The Loose Special participated in 1933, 1935 and 1938 air races.{{cite web|title=Thompson Faq|url=http://www.flyingacesclub.com/thompson.pdf|accessdate=17 mber 2011}} In the 1948 Goodyear Formula One Air Races pilot [[Earl Ortman]] placed fourth at a speed of {{convert|127.339|mph|km/h|0|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|title=Earl Ortman|url=http://goldenageofaviation.org/ortman.htm|accessdate=17 November 2011}}
